entry.title: è€ƒç ”è‹±è¯­æ¨¡æ¿
entry.content:
Dear jack,
How is everything going ?Having learned that you plan to find a job in China ,I am writing to offer some suggestions to you.
First of all ,it is advisable for you to have a clear career planning before deciding on a certain job that suits your interest and skills.Secondly ,it would be a good notion,provided that you could utilize prevalent websites in China such as Boss .Thirdly ,I suggest that you prepare a resume beforehand and have it proofread by a Chinese friend .I would like to do that for you.
I hope my suggestion will be of some help to you . If you have any questions or you need any help ,do not hesitate to contact me .

Plan on sth/doing sth
Career planning =resume
Job-hunting =recruitment
Suit your interest and skills
Bring joy and satisfaction
Make good use of =utilize =take advantage of
Prepare sth beforehand
Proofread væ ¡å¯¹

Dear Li Ming
Many congratulations on your success and achievement to Peeks university .Each and every sacrifice that you have made has paid you well.As a friend who has experienced ups and down in college ,i feel obligated to offer plenty of suggestions to you .
Fist of all ,it is advisable for you to have your future career planned before diving into serious studying. In this way ,you can select the right courses to maximize you learning outcomes .Secondly,it would be a good idea if you make good use of the school library and read extensively.A good reading habit will bring tremendous benefits to you.Thirdly , i suggest that you participant in various extracurricular activities ,which not only gives you opportunities to make new friends but also improve your interpersonal skills.
I hope my suggestions would be of help to you .if you have any questions or you need any help not hesitate to contact me .

Experience ups and downs ç»å†é£é›¨
Dive into é’»ç ”äº
Maximize /minimize
Read extensively
Bring tremendous benefits to you
Interpersonal skills äººé™…äº¤å¾€èƒ½åŠ›

å¤´è„‘é£æš´:4w+å‡†å¤‡ who what
Graduates/faculty members
What :opening remarks performance take photos

Dear professors,
My name is Li Ming, and i am the president of the Student Union in our university.Since the seniors are graduating this June,I am writing on behalf of the Student Union to invite you to attend the graduation ceremony.
The ceremony is scheduled to be held in the school auditorium from 9 am to 11am on May 7th.More than 200 students,along with all faculty members and graduates ,will attend the event.The ceremony will start with opening remarks by our school president Dr Liu,and graduate of each class will give wonderful performances after that.At the end of the ritual,graduates will be given their certificates and take photos with the president and their teachers
If you have any questions ,please do not hesitate to contact us .We would greatly appreciate it if you could inform us of your decision at your earliest convenience.We look forward to your reply

è‡ªæˆ‘ä»‹ç»
My name is Liming ,and i am the president of the Student Union/Booking Reading Club in Peaking University /in our university
My name is Liming ,and i am a senior majoring in Economics in Peaking University

å¤´è„‘é£æš´4 w what where when who

Dear friends
My name is Li Ming, and i am on behalf of Student Union to invite you to take part in the upcoming food festival ,which aims at introducing various Chinese food to international students.
The festival is scheduled to be held in the school canteen from 9 am to 1 pm on May 7th.Students from all countries are invited ,along with chefs who are expert in making Chinese food.You will have an opportunity to witness the cooking process of many popular Chinese dishes and have a bite of those that you are intrigued in. There will also be a game at the end of the festival to test you knowledge on Chinese food.
If you have any questions ,please do not hesitate to contact us .We look forward to your participant.

Take part in =participant in
Introduce sth to sb
Be expert in
Witness
Have a bite of å°ä¸€å°
Test you knowledge on sth

æ¨èä¿¡
æ•™æˆ ä¸ç†Ÿæ‚‰-æ­£å¼-Dear professor Cook
æ¨èæ—…æ¸¸ æ™¯ç‚¹ +åŸå› 
å¤´è„‘é£æš´ The Great Wall The forbidden city
åƒå– ä¹°çºªå¿µå“

Dear Professor Cook,
Welcome to Beijing! Having learned that you love traveling ,I am writing to recommend some place to you.
First of all ,the forbidden city is a pretty good place for you because it is a masterpiece of Chinese architecture and has irreplaceable culture significance.Secondly,i suggest you pay a visit to Wangfujing Snack Street where you can find a large selection of traditional Chinese snacks and give yourself a treat .Besides , if you like to purchase some interesting souvenirs and handcrafts, Nanluoguxiang is a great choice.There are many shops with different styles.Th quality is much better than the street shops. It is opening till 10 pm,so it is also good to visit after a whole day of travel
I hope my recommendations are of some help to you. If you have any questions or need,please feel free to contact me .

entry.title: ç²¾å½©è¯­å¥
entry.content:
One reason Owlestone's device has generated such interest is that it has a documented record

Theories focusing on the role of society suggest that children commit crimes in response to their failure to rise above their socioeconomic status ,or as a rejection of middle-class values

in fact , instead of straining muscles to built them as exercise dose ,laughter apparently accomplishes the opposite

it is a well -studied species ,and among the facts that have emerged about it is that individual birds do ,indeed , have distict personanlites

But to the extent that unpredictability is part of how people understand themselves and part of what people like about themselves ,humanity is in the process of losing something significant
.As they become more and more predictable ,the creature inhabiting the increasingly AI-mediated world will become less and less like us .

Containers may came loose in heavy whether and there is a chance of lighting knocking out communication.

They demonstrate that lighting strikes the Indian Ocean and the South China sea almost twice as often along shipping lanes as it does other areas of these waters .

As the map shows , those strikes that happened over the ocean were concentrated in places most plied by ships .In particular ,the shipping lane that passes from the south of Sri Lanka to the northern entrance of the straits of Malacca , and thence down the straits to Singapore,positively glows with lighting .(Its westward extension to the Suez canal was outside the study area .)So do the lanes from Singapore an the western part of Malaysia that head north-east across the South China Sea (å€’è£…)

Neither changes in vertical wind shear nor differences in horizontal air movements seem likely to be causing this concentration of thunderstorms ,for other measurements suggest that these weather-modifying phenomena are the same inside shipping lanes as they are in neighbouring parts of the atmosphere immediately outside those lanes .Nor does it seem plausible that the ships themselves (admittedly made of metal ,and also the tallest structures on what is otherwise a flat surface )are responsible for attracting all the extra strikes involved .

The most likely explanation is particulate pollution emitted by ships using the shipping lanes

Typical marine clouds in unpolluted areas are composed of large droplets and do not rise to high altitude,but Dr Thornton and his team reckon that smaller droplets ,of sort that condense around oxides of sulphur,might more easily be carried upward by convection -forming,as they rose ,into towering storm clouds that would act as nurseries of lighting bolts
